rev.comment: I dare to say "Going Legit?" is probably not the best title for a section, renaming it. Could use further work
rev.diff:
Line 38: Line 38:
Hiren's BootCD was created by "Hiren" & "Pankaj" and is based on [[Knoppix]] (a bootable Linux operating system) and a collection of other freeware tools. It has found some controversial stigma as a "hacker" tool violating copyright. However, today the majority of its software is freeware or shareware.
Hiren's BootCD was created by "Hiren" & "Pankaj" and is based on [[Knoppix]] (a bootable Linux operating system) and a collection of other freeware tools. It has found some controversial stigma as a "hacker" tool violating copyright. However, today the majority of its software is freeware or shareware.
â
===Going Legit?===
+
===Licensing issues===
Prior to version 11.0, Hiren's BootCD contained a significant number of [[Commercial Software|commercial products]]. In version 10.6<ref>{{cite web|title=Version 10.6 Release Notes|url=http://www.hirensbootcd.org/hbcd-v106/}}</ref>, no less than 17 were listed in the release notes. Most notably [[Acronis True Image]], [[Norton Ghost]], [[Acronis|Acronis Disk Director]], and [[Paragon Software Group|Paragon Partition Manager]]. ([[Partition Magic|Partition Magic Pro]] had been replaced already in version 10.5.) To be able to start a commercial application, the user had to promise to be the holder of a license, but no validation of this statement was ever made.
Prior to version 11.0, Hiren's BootCD contained a significant number of [[Commercial Software|commercial products]]. In version 10.6<ref>{{cite web|title=Version 10.6 Release Notes|url=http://www.hirensbootcd.org/hbcd-v106/}}</ref>, no less than 17 were listed in the release notes. Most notably [[Acronis True Image]], [[Norton Ghost]], [[Acronis|Acronis Disk Director]], and [[Paragon Software Group|Paragon Partition Manager]]. ([[Partition Magic|Partition Magic Pro]] had been replaced already in version 10.5.) To be able to start a commercial application, the user had to promise to be the holder of a license, but no validation of this statement was ever made.
